docs.text: Game Development ¶ 3D ¶ ⭐ crocotile3d — A tool for creating 3d scenes with tiles. Think of it as creating 2d tilemaps with three dimensions. LMMS — Cross-platform music production software. mixxx — A Free DJ software that gives you everything you need to perform live mixes. Video composition ¶ Natron — Open-source video compositing software. Node-graph based. Similar in functionalities to Adobe After Effects and Nuke by The Foundry.

docs.text: Godot Game Engine ¶ AI ¶ surfacer — AI and pathfinding for 2D-platformers in Godot. Animation ¶ Anima — Run sequential and parallel animations with less code. godot-aseprite-wizard — Godot Editor plugin to help import Aseprite animations to AnimationPlayers, AnimatedSprites and SpriteFrames. Assets ¶ OpenGameArt — Arts for developping games. CI / CD ¶ Continuous Delivery pipeline for Godot and itch.io Controller ¶ Virtual-Joystick-Godot — A simple virtual joystick for touchscreens, for both 2D and 3D games, with useful options. Dialogs ¶ Textalog — A Dialogue System for Godot Engine. godot_dialogue_manager — A simple but powerful branching dialogue system for Godot. Demos ¶ tps-demo — Godot Third Person Shooter with high quality assets and lighting. godot-tactical-rpg — A tactical role-playing game demo for the Godot Engine. godot-2d-space-game — A 2D space exploration and mining game made with Godot and GDQuest's AI framework. Event processing ¶ Godot-EventSystem — An easy but powerful event system implementation for Godot Engine. Extension ¶ goost — A general-purpose, extensible and customizable C++ extension for Godot Engine. Framework ¶ godot-card-game-framework — A framework which comes with prepared scenes and classes to kickstart your card game, as well as a powerful scripting engine to use to provide full rules enforcement. Plugins ¶ godot-git-plugin — A Git plugin for the Godot Editor. godot-powerful — List of plugins to turn godot into a most powerful engine that already is. Procedural ¶ godot-procedural-generation — Procedural generation algorithms and demos for the Godot game engine. material-maker — A procedural textures authoring and 3D model painting tool based on the Godot game engine. Publishing ¶ GodotSteam — Steam API for the Godot game engine. Shaders ¶ Godot Shaders — A community-driven shader library for the Godot game engine. Templates ¶ Godot-GameTemplate — Template with all necessary stuff taken care, just create your games main features. Escoria — Libre framework for the creation of point-and-click adventure games. Terrain modeling ¶ SmartShape2D — A 2D Terrain Tool. godot_voxel — Voxel module for Godot Engine. Voxel-Core — Voxel plugin for the Godot game engine! godot_spatial_gardener — A plugin for painting plants and props on arbitrary 3D surfaces implemented in GDScript. Tests ¶ WAT — A Testing Plugin for Godot Game Engine Gut — Godot Unit Test. Unit testing tool for Godot Game Engine. Visual effects ¶ godot-visual-effects — Open-source visual effects designed in Godot, from our VFX Secrets course.
docs.title: Godot Game Engine

docs.text: Golang ¶ Command Line Interface ¶ cobra [ 📘 docs ] — A Commander for modern Go CLI interactions. bubbletea — A powerful little TUI framework. pterm — A modern Go module to easily beautify console output. Featuring charts, progressbars, tables, trees, text input, select menus and much more gum — A tool for glamorous shell scripts. It provides highly configurable, ready-to-use utilities to help you write useful shell scripts and dotfiles aliases with just a few lines of code. Database ¶ dolt — A SQL database that you can fork, clone, branch, merge, push and pull just like a git repository. Desktop ¶ wails — Create desktop apps using Go and Web Technologies. Game Engines ¶ ebiten — A dead simple 2D game library for Go Image manipulation ¶ imgproxy [ 📘 docs ] — Fast and secure standalone server for resizing and converting remote images. Kubernetes ¶ kooper — A simple Go library to create Kubernetes operators and controllers. Microservice ¶ chi — A lightweight, idiomatic and composable router for building Go HTTP services. Security ¶ teller — A secrets management tool for developers. Text manipulation ¶ gron — Make JSON greppable! Web frameworks ¶ buffalo — Rapid Web Development w/ Go.
docs.title: Golang

docs.text: Kubernetes ¶ Authentication ¶ kubelogin — Plugin for Kubernetes OpenID Connect authentication. Backup ¶ k8up — Kubernetes and OpenShift Backup Operator Cleaning ¶ kube-janitor — Clean up (delete) Kubernetes resources after a configured TTL (time to live). Costing ¶ kube-opex-analytics — Usage Analytics and Accounting for Cost Allocation and Capacity Planning. Limited free edition . Database ¶ schemahero — A Kubernetes operator for declarative database schema management (gitops for database schemas). Debugger ¶ buildg — Interactive debugger for Dockerfile, with support for IDEs (VS Code, Emacs, Neovim, etc.) Development ¶ gefyra — Blazingly-fast rocket, rock-solid, local application development with Kubernetes. Kubebuilder Documentation ¶ crd-ref-docs — Generates Kubernetes CRD API reference documentation. Exams ¶ Kubernetes Certified Administrator — Online resources that will help you prepare for taking the CNCF CKA 2020 "Kubernetes Certified Administrator" Certification exam. Inventory ¶ kubectl-images — Show container images used in the cluster. Monitoring ¶ pixie — Instant Kubernetes-Native Application Observability pyrra — Making SLOs with Prometheus manageable, accessible, and easy to use for everyone! kiali — Observability for the Istio service mesh. Networking ¶ kube-vip [ homepage ] — Provides Kubernetes clusters with a virtual IP and load balancer for both the control plane (for building a highly-available cluster) and Kubernetes Services of type LoadBalancer without relying on any external hardware or software. k8spacket — helps to understand TCP packets traffic in your kubernetes cluster with packets traffic visualization. wireguard-operator — A wireguard operator created to easily provision a VPN in a k8s cluster. Scheduler ¶ furiko — an operator for managing, scheduling and executing scheduled and adhoc jobs and workflows (including cron jobs, batch processing, workflow automation, ...). Security ¶ Hardening Your Kubernetes Cluster — Covers the NSA and CISA guide on Kubernetes hardening in a serie of articles. Part 1 Part 2 ThreatMapper — Open source cloud native security observability platform. Linux, K8s, AWS Fargate and more. falco — Cloud Native Runtime Security stackrox — The StackRox Kubernetes Security Platform performs a risk analysis of the container environment, delivers visibility and runtime alerts, and provides recommendations to proactively improve security by hardening the environment. Operators ¶ config-syncer — Keeps ConfigMaps and Secrets synchronized across namespaces and/or clusters. Tests ¶ kuttl — provides a declarative approach to test Kubernetes Operators and any kubernetes objects.
docs.title: Kubernetes

docs.text: Networking ¶ Datacenter Infrastructure Management ¶ netbox — A solution for modeling and documenting modern networks by combining the traditional disciplines of IPAM and DCIM with powerful APIs and extensions. Distributions ¶ opnsense — An open source, easy-to-use and easy-to-build FreeBSD based firewall and routing platform. Misc ¶ MTU discovery ¶ for i in ` seq 1460 1500 ` ; do ping -c1 -s $i -M do 1 .1.1.1 ; sleep 0 .1 ; done Overlay networks ¶ nebula — A scalable overlay networking tool with a focus on performance, simplicity and security. Tunnel ¶ pritunl — A distributed enterprise vpn server built using the OpenVPN protocol. tunnelmon — An (auto)ssh tunnel monitor. It gives a user interface to monitor existing SSH tunnels, and tunnels that are managed with autossh. Virtual Networks ¶ netmaker — Makes networks with WireGuard. Automates fast, secure, and distributed virtual networks.
docs.title: Networking

docs.text: Python ¶ About ¶ I started this list in 2019 to keep my findings around cool Python projects I may use or work with. This is the time now to share it 🎉 Enjoy ❤️ AI ¶ min-dalle — A minimal implementation of DALL·E Mini. API ¶ ⭐ fastapi — FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production. zeep ( docs ) — A modern/fast python SOAP client based on lxml / requests. ⭐ flipt — An open-source, on-prem feature flag solution. Cross languages. fastapi-best-practices — Best Practices and Conventions for Fast API. Authentication ¶ ⭐ authentik — An open-source Identity Provider focused on flexibility and versatility. Automation ¶ ⭐ doit ( docs ) — bringing the power of build-tools to execute any kind of task. ⭐ fabric — Simple, Pythonic remote execution and deployment. invoke — Pythonic task management & command execution. pyautogui — Used to programmatically control the mouse & keyboard. Builds ¶ ⭐ pyinstaller — Freeze (package) Python programs into stand-alone executables ⭐ Nuitka ( sources ) — translates the Python modules into a C level program that then uses libpython and static C files of its own to execute in the same way as CPython does. pants — Pants v2 is a fast, scalable build system for growing codebases. PyOxidizer — a modern Python application packaging and distribution tool. tiamat — Single binary builder for Python projects. Code Quality ¶ commitizen — Create committing rules for projects 🚀 auto bump versions ⬆️ and auto changelog generation 📂 ⭐ pre-commit — A framework for managing and maintaining multi-language pre-commit hooks. variables naming cheatsheet — Comprehensive language-agnostic guidelines on variables naming. ⭐ prospector — Inspects Python source files and provides information about type and location of classes, methods etc... gitlint — Linting for your git commit messages. Command Line Interface ¶ ⭐ inquirer — A collection of common interactive command line user interfaces, based on Inquirer.js typer — Typer, build great CLIs. Easy to code. Based on Python type hints. ⭐ Click — Python package for creating beautiful command line interfaces in a composable way with as little code as necessary. cloup ( docs ) — Library to build command line interfaces (CLIs) based on Click. Cloup = Click + option groups, constraints, command aliases, command sections, help themes, "did you mean ...?" suggestions ... click-extra ( docs ) — Extra colorization and configuration loading for Click. ⭐ rich ( docs ) — a Python library for rich text and beautiful formatting in the terminal. Configuration ¶ ⭐ everett — Everett is a Python configuration library for your app. decouple — Decouple helps you to organize your settings so that you can change parameters without having to redeploy your app. classyconf — Declarative and extensible library for configuration & code separation. ConfZ — ConfZ is a configuration management library for Python based on pydantic. Conversions ¶ ⭐ python-slugify — Returns unicode slugs. Courses ¶ Python Programming Language — GeeksforGeeks Cryptography ¶ cryptography [ docs ] — A package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers. Data structures ¶ docarray — The data structure for unstructured data. Date and time ¶ arrow — Arrow is a Python library that offers a sensible and human-friendly approach to creating, manipulating, formatting and converting dates, times and timestamps. Data parsing & validation ¶ apischema — JSON (de)serialization, GraphQL and JSON schema generation using Python typing. ⭐ pydantic — Data parsing and validation using Python type hints. msgspec — A fast and friendly JSON/MessagePack library, with optional schema validation. Debugging ¶ PySnooper — A poor man's debugger. If you've used Bash, it's like set -x for Python, except it's fancier. Design patterns ¶ ⭐ Python Design Patterns — Ideas about Python and Design Patterns all in one place. faif/python-patterns — A collection of design patterns/idioms in Python. Diagrams ¶ ⭐ diagrams — Diagram as Code for prototyping cloud system architectures Documents ¶ borb — A library for reading, creating and manipulating PDF files in python. Distribution ¶ ⭐ pex — A library for generating .pex (Python EXecutable) files which are executable Python environments in the spirit of virtualenvs. zipapp — This module provides tools to manage the creation of zip files containing Python code, which can be executed directly by the Python interpreter. voilà — Voilà turns Jupyter notebooks into standalone web applications. Databases ¶ peewee ( docs ) — a small, expressive orm that supports postgresql, mysql and sqlite. Documentation ¶ ⭐ MkDocs with MkDocs Material — Project documentation with Markdown (themed with Material Design). furo — Furo is a nice theme for Sphinx. mkdocs-charts-plugin — Plugin to create plots from data using the declarative vegalite syntax. E-Commerce solutions ¶ saleor — A modular, high performance, headless e-commerce platform built with Python, GraphQL, Django, and React. oscar — An e-commerce framework for Django designed for building domain-driven sites.. shuup [ docs ] — An Open Source E-Commerce Platform based on Django and Python with multi-vendors support. cartridge — A shopping cart application designed to provide a clean and simple base for developing e-commerce websites. Games development ¶ ⭐ arcade — An easy-to-learn Python library for creating 2D video games. It is ideal for people learning to program, or developers that want to code a 2D game without learning a complex framework. pyxel — A retro game engine for Python. GUI ¶ DearPyGui — A fast and powerful Graphical User Interface Toolkit for Python with minimal dependencies. Information gathering ¶ sherlock — Hunt down social media accounts by username across social networks. Image manipulation ¶ Real-ESRGAN — Real-ESRGAN aims at developing Practical Algorithms for General Image Restoration. QualityScaler — Image/video upscaling GUI app based on BRSGAN & RealSR_JPEG wand — A ctypes-based simple ImageMagick binding with Python modern interfaces. Integrations ¶ pycord — A python wrapper for the Discord API. Logging ¶ ⭐ structlog [docs] — Structured Logging for Python. exceptionite — A Python Exception Library. Designed to make handling and displaying exceptions a cinch. Network ¶ ⭐ mitmproxy ( pip ) — A free and open source interactive HTTPS proxy. ⭐ dnspython — a DNS toolkit for Python. It can be used for queries, zone transfers, dynamic updates, nameserver testing, and many other things. Notifications ¶ apprise — Push Notifications that work with just about every platform ! Parsing ¶ jello — CLI tool to filter JSON and JSON Lines data with Python syntax (Similar to jq). jp — Command line interface to JMESPath. jc — CLI tool and python library that converts the output of popular command-line tools and file-types to JSON or Dictionaries. This allows piping of output to tools like jq and simplifying automation scripts. markdown-it-py — Markdown parser, done right. 100% CommonMark support, extensions, syntax plugins & high speed. Now in Python! reader — A feed reader library. Schedulers ¶ rocketry — Modern scheduling library for Python. Security ¶ ⭐ keyring — An easy way to access the system keyring service from python. It can be used in any application that needs safe password storage. Sound & Music ¶ spotify-downloader — Download your Spotify playlists and songs along with album art and metadata (from YouTube if a match is found). Static Sites ¶ furo — A clean customizable documentation theme for Sphinx. Styling ¶ black — The uncompromising Python code formatter. Task queues ¶ huey [ docs ] — A little task queue for python. Telemetry ¶ opentelemetry — a collection of tools, APIs, and SDKs. You use it to instrument, generate, collect, and export telemetry data (metrics, logs, and traces) for analysis in order to understand your software's performance and behavior. Templates ¶ mako — a template library written in Python. It provides a familiar, non-XML syntax which compiles into Python modules for maximum performance. Tests ¶ nox — Flexible test automation for Python. Like tox but using a Python file for configuration. ⭐ tox — automate and standardize testing in Python. tox-pipenv — a tox plugin to replace the default use of virtualenv with Pipenv. ⭐ robotframework — generic automation framework for acceptance testing and RPA. locust [ home ] — Scalable user load testing tool written in Python. faker — A Python package that generates fake data for you. Video editing ¶ ⭐ videogrep — Automatic video supercuts with Python. Version control ¶ ⭐ GitPython — A python library used to interact with Git repositories. Virtual environments ¶ ⭐ nodenv — Virtual environment for Node.js & integrator with virtualenv.
docs.title: Python

docs.text: I started this list in 2019 to keep my findings around cool Python projects I may use or work with. This is the time now to share it 🎉 Enjoy ❤️
docs.title: About

docs.text: min-dalle — A minimal implementation of DALL·E Mini.
docs.title: AI

docs.text: ⭐ fastapi — FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production. zeep ( docs ) — A modern/fast python SOAP client based on lxml / requests. ⭐ flipt — An open-source, on-prem feature flag solution. Cross languages. fastapi-best-practices — Best Practices and Conventions for Fast API.
docs.title: API

docs.text: ⭐ authentik — An open-source Identity Provider focused on flexibility and versatility.
docs.title: Authentication

docs.text: ⭐ doit ( docs ) — bringing the power of build-tools to execute any kind of task. ⭐ fabric — Simple, Pythonic remote execution and deployment. invoke — Pythonic task management & command execution. pyautogui — Used to programmatically control the mouse & keyboard.
docs.title: Automation

docs.text: ⭐ pyinstaller — Freeze (package) Python programs into stand-alone executables ⭐ Nuitka ( sources ) — translates the Python modules into a C level program that then uses libpython and static C files of its own to execute in the same way as CPython does. pants — Pants v2 is a fast, scalable build system for growing codebases. PyOxidizer — a modern Python application packaging and distribution tool. tiamat — Single binary builder for Python projects.
docs.title: Builds

docs.text: commitizen — Create committing rules for projects 🚀 auto bump versions ⬆️ and auto changelog generation 📂 ⭐ pre-commit — A framework for managing and maintaining multi-language pre-commit hooks. variables naming cheatsheet — Comprehensive language-agnostic guidelines on variables naming. ⭐ prospector — Inspects Python source files and provides information about type and location of classes, methods etc... gitlint — Linting for your git commit messages.
docs.title: Code Quality

docs.text: ⭐ inquirer — A collection of common interactive command line user interfaces, based on Inquirer.js typer — Typer, build great CLIs. Easy to code. Based on Python type hints. ⭐ Click — Python package for creating beautiful command line interfaces in a composable way with as little code as necessary. cloup ( docs ) — Library to build command line interfaces (CLIs) based on Click. Cloup = Click + option groups, constraints, command aliases, command sections, help themes, "did you mean ...?" suggestions ... click-extra ( docs ) — Extra colorization and configuration loading for Click. ⭐ rich ( docs ) — a Python library for rich text and beautiful formatting in the terminal.
docs.title: Command Line Interface

docs.text: ⭐ everett — Everett is a Python configuration library for your app. decouple — Decouple helps you to organize your settings so that you can change parameters without having to redeploy your app. classyconf — Declarative and extensible library for configuration & code separation. ConfZ — ConfZ is a configuration management library for Python based on pydantic.
docs.title: Configuration

docs.text: ⭐ python-slugify — Returns unicode slugs.
docs.title: Conversions

docs.text: Python Programming Language — GeeksforGeeks
docs.title: Courses

docs.title: Data structures

docs.text: arrow — Arrow is a Python library that offers a sensible and human-friendly approach to creating, manipulating, formatting and converting dates, times and timestamps.
docs.title: Date and time

docs.text: apischema — JSON (de)serialization, GraphQL and JSON schema generation using Python typing. ⭐ pydantic — Data parsing and validation using Python type hints. msgspec — A fast and friendly JSON/MessagePack library, with optional schema validation.
docs.title: Data parsing & validation

docs.text: PySnooper — A poor man's debugger. If you've used Bash, it's like set -x for Python, except it's fancier.

docs.text: ⭐ Python Design Patterns — Ideas about Python and Design Patterns all in one place. faif/python-patterns — A collection of design patterns/idioms in Python.

docs.title: Diagrams

docs.text: ⭐ pex — A library for generating .pex (Python EXecutable) files which are executable Python environments in the spirit of virtualenvs. zipapp — This module provides tools to manage the creation of zip files containing Python code, which can be executed directly by the Python interpreter. voilà — Voilà turns Jupyter notebooks into standalone web applications.
docs.title: Distribution

docs.text: peewee ( docs ) — a small, expressive orm that supports postgresql, mysql and sqlite.
docs.title: Databases

docs.text: ⭐ MkDocs with MkDocs Material — Project documentation with Markdown (themed with Material Design). furo — Furo is a nice theme for Sphinx. mkdocs-charts-plugin — Plugin to create plots from data using the declarative vegalite syntax.
docs.title: Documentation

docs.text: saleor — A modular, high performance, headless e-commerce platform built with Python, GraphQL, Django, and React. oscar — An e-commerce framework for Django designed for building domain-driven sites.. shuup [ docs ] — An Open Source E-Commerce Platform based on Django and Python with multi-vendors support. cartridge — A shopping cart application designed to provide a clean and simple base for developing e-commerce websites.
docs.title: E-Commerce solutions

docs.text: ⭐ arcade — An easy-to-learn Python library for creating 2D video games. It is ideal for people learning to program, or developers that want to code a 2D game without learning a complex framework. pyxel — A retro game engine for Python.

docs.text: Self-Hosted ¶ Automation ¶ huginn — Create agents that monitor and act on your behalf. Build agents that perform automated tasks for you online. Diagrams ¶ kroki — Aa unified API which creates diagrams from textual descriptions. Documentation ¶ outline — The fastest wiki and knowledge base for growing teams. Beautiful, realtime, feature rich, and markdown compatible. DNS ¶ serverless-dns — The RethinkDNS resolver that deploys to Cloudflare Workers, Deno Deploy, and Fly.io. File sharing ¶ psitransfer — Simple open source self-hosted file sharing solution. KVM ¶ ⭐ tinypilot — Use your Raspberry Pi as a browser-based KVM. Meetings ¶ cal.com — Scheduling infrastructure for absolutely everyone. Meta-Engines ¶ ⭐ searxng — A free internet metasearch engine which aggregates results from various search services and databases. Users are neither tracked nor profiled. Newsletter ¶ listmonk — High performance, self-hosted, newsletter and mailing list manager with a modern dashboard. Single binary app. Photo sharing ¶ pixelfed — Photo Sharing. For Everyone. Videos ¶ invidious — An alternative front-end to YouTube.

docs.text: Utilities ¶ Communication ¶ signal-export — Export your Signal chats to markdown files with attachments. Build Systems ¶ ninja — A small build system with a focus on speed. Development ¶ vscode-dev-containers — A repository of development container definitions for the VS Code Remote - Containers extension. devbox — A command-line tool that lets you easily create isolated shells and containers. You start by defining the list of packages required by your development environment, and devbox uses that definition to create an isolated environment just for your application. Databases ¶ atlas — an open source tool that helps developers manage their database schemas using HCL language. Jailer — Database Subsetting and Relational Data Browsing Tool. Data transforms ¶ kestra — An infinitely scalable orchestration and scheduling platform, creating, running, scheduling, and monitoring millions of complex pipelines. label-studio — a multi-type data labeling and annotation tool with standardized output format. File systems ¶ watchman — Watches files and records, or triggers actions, when they change. Internet ¶ uneed — The best tools on the internet, curated by hand, daily. Misc ¶ /proc ¶ Operating Systems ¶ netboot.xyz — A network-based bootable operating system installer based on iPXE. Security ¶ hackingtool — ALL IN ONE Hacking Tool For Hackers trufflehog — Find credentials all over the place wazuh — An open source platform used for threat prevention, detection, and response. It is capable of protecting workloads across on-premises, virtualized, containerized, and cloud-based environments. Social networks ¶ Infinity for Reddit — A Reddit client on Android written in Java. It does not have any ads and it features clean UI and smooth browsing experience. Terminal ¶ Warp — A blazingly-fast modern Rust based GPU-accelerated terminal built to make you and your team more productive. Version managers ¶ asdf — Extendable version manager with support for Ruby, Node.js, Elixir, Erlang & more.

docs.text: Web development ¶ CSS ¶ Houdini — A set of low-level APIs that exposes parts of the CSS engine, giving developers the power to extend CSS by hooking into the styling and layout process of a browser’s rendering engine. Bulma — the modern CSS framework that just works. Fonts ¶ Bunny — a GDPR compliant alternative to Google Fonts. Templates ¶ tabler — A premium and open source dashboard template with a responsive and high-quality UI.
